description: My dad passed away last year and this was his project that never happened. I would like to pass this on to another avid fisherman that would love it as my dad would have. We totally rebuilt the 90 horse inboard 20 years ago and it has mabye 10 hours on it. he never put it on the water just started it every 2 or 3 months to make sure it ran. Until he got sick. 67 hours on engine meter since new... 24 foot house boat which is like a motor home on pontoons. ...he pulled the interior out to restore it and passed away before it was done. i have all of that in the garage ...sink oven fridge. ...all the cushions. .. way to much to list but if your interested its worth taking a look at. people have been asking width so its 8 foot 2 inches wide and 80 inches inside wall to wall. The trailer for this boat is worth almost what im asking for the boat itself.. its got 3 axles with brakes and 2 brand new tires we just bought so the buyer could get it home. I have a video of the engine running . Its a project but could be on the water as is with minor work. The title says CruiserCamper , hull type: Cabin. He purchased it in 1990. Clean title which in michigan is required for boats 20 ft or larger. Call me with any questions. Also it is all fiberglass with steel trailer. I found a book on houseboats he bought that has an interesting artical on this exact boat. Mabye a year or two different but definitely this boat and address of the manufacturer. Call or text only. Today i ran into more stuff in his garage a new bilge blower and a graph style fish finder its really neat...prints an actual picture of the bottom of the lake and the fish...better than a little bleep on the other style...call anytime im up late most nights... Thanks Jeff
title: 24 ft house boat project...

description: I'm selling our 1987Wellcraft Nova 23 cuddy cabin. It has a 7.5 litre 460 engine hooked to a omc king cobra outdrive. It only has 305 original hours on it. I'm the third owner of this boat that I purchased from a friend. I have most of the original manuals and the original sales sticker for it. It runs and drives good. There are no issues with this boat. The interior is is good shape with no weather cracks. It has snap in carpet with a fiberglass floor. The exterior could stand to be detailed. I buffed it last year but it has some scratches. Most can be wet sanded out but there are a few that won't be able to. It does have some dock rash. It had bottom paint on it because the guy I bought it from kept it in the water. He did this for a few years. The owner before him bought it new and kept it on a lift covered on the bay. It has a tandem axle trailer that could use some TLC. The lights all work but the brakes don't. It has 4 new tires and 1 new wheel bearings. It has a teak swim platform and teak around the windshield. There are no covers or canvas. So like I said the inside is nice and the outside could use a little TLC. It's a good solid boat that handles bigger waves nice. I'm asking $6000. Very low hour boat for the year. I'm not interested in any trades. Stored indoors every winter since new. 231-threefour2-2threeonesix. Thanks
title: 1987 Wellcraft Nova 23

description: For sale is a late 50's or early 60's antique Aqua Queen 14 foot aluminum boat and a modern galvanized Karavan trailer.  The boat is listed as a 14 footer but actual length when measured from the transom to the bow tip is 13 feet and 4 inches.  (There is no motor.  The motor in the pictures is not included.)  The boat is in very, very nice condition.   It gets lots of looks at the launch, on the water or in a parking lot.   I don't have a good interior picture but the front seat is somewhat of a bench style seat with a backrest but at the center of the backrest there is a small step through area to access the rear of the boat were there is another bench seat but without a back rest.    The boat is set up for a motor with a 20 inch shaft but it could easily be modified for a motor with a 15 inch shaft.     This is an excellent little boat for cruising in vintage style and getting lots of compliments at a relatively low cost or an equally excellent little boat for fishing or even to use as a first boat for the kids that is easy to handle, low maintenance and won't break the bank.

Read below all the custom features and safety equipment added since we have owned the boat.  Very few 30' sailboats have powered windlass to lower and raise the anchor, this one does.  This boat is set up for comfortable day sailing as well as cruising.   My wife and I piloted this boat to the North Channel in Canada on two occasions. 1982 Catalina 30 Tall Rig hull #CTYN2859M82K with inboard Universal 5411 diesel engine. Well maintained, lots of upgrades. . .. . .. . .. . .. . .. . .. . .. . .. Boat Features: This fine boat is set up for day sailing and cruising. Note the features and accessories. Sunbrella Dodger and Biminy Original 4 post steel cradle Garmin GPS Auto Pilot Updated Garhauer flat main sheet traveler and solid vang Flex-O-Fold folding 2 blade prop Lazy Jack main sail folding system "Mack Pack" by Mack Sails Colorful cruising spinnaker Lewmar electric Horizon anchor windlass with 40' chain spliced to 200 feet of rope. Lewmar anchor and upgraded anchor bow roller Custom dense foam "C-Cushions" Beautiful cabin, refinished teak cabinets and doors Custom made teak settee table in cabin Custom made teak nav station top. Custom made teak V-berth shelf Custom made teak step to V-berth Custom made teak folding screen door for companionway Tufted Topper foam mattress for V-berth Custom made teak folding cockpit table and integrated beverage holder. Recent mainsail replacement, by Mack Sails Masthead hardware replaced with new ball bearing sheaves, light, and other new hardware installed Updated refrigeration system utilizes existing ice box, for 110v use. Three batteries, single starting battery, two house batteries. Pro-Smart 3 way battery charger delivers charging only to the batteries that require charging Replaced toilet in 2006 ENGINE HOURS UNKNOWN, I HAD TO PUT A NUMBER IN THAT SPACE.
